TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GpioPin extends System.Object

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.Device.Gpio.PinMode GetPinMode() cil managed
Public Overridable Function GetPinMode () As PinMode

Docs.summary: Gets the current pin mode for the general-purpose I/O (GPIO) pin. The pin mode specifies whether the pin is configured as an input or an output, and determines how values are driven onto the pin.
Docs.returns: An enumeration value that indicates the current pin mode for the GPIO pin. The pin mode specifies whether the pin is configured as an input or an output, and determines how values are driven onto the pin.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsPinModeSupported (System.Device.Gpio.PinMode pinMode);

Docs.param: The pin mode that you want to check for support.
Docs.summary: Gets whether the general-purpose I/O (GPIO) pin supports the specified pin mode.
Docs.returns: if the GPIO pin supports the pin mode that pinMode specifies; otherwise false. If you specify a pin mode for which this method returns when you call , generates an exception.

Docs.summary: Gets the pin number of the general-purpose I/O (GPIO) pin.

Docs.summary: Reads the current value of the general-purpose I/O (GPIO) pin.
Docs.returns: The current value of the GPIO pin. If the pin is configured as an output, this value is the last value written to the pin.

Docs.param: An enumeration value that specifies pin mode to use for the GPIO pin. The pin mode specifies whether the pin is configured as an input or an output, and determines how values are driven onto the pin.
Docs.summary: Sets the pin mode of the general-purpose I/O (GPIO) pin. The pin mode specifies whether the pin is configured as an input or an output, and determines how values are driven onto the pin.
Docs.exception: The GPIO pin does not support the specified pin mode.

Docs.summary: Toggles the output of the general purpose I/O (GPIO) pin if the pin is configured as an output.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the general-purpose I/O (GPIO) pin changes, either because of an external stimulus when the pin is configured as an input, or when a value is written to the pin when the pin in configured as an output.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Write (System.Device.Gpio.PinValue value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Write(valuetype System.Device.Gpio.PinValue value) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub Write (value As PinValue)
abstract member Write : System.Device.Gpio.PinValue -> unit override this.Write : System.Device.Gpio.PinValue -> unit

Docs.param:
The enumeration value to write to the GPIO pin.
If the GPIO pin is configured as an output, the method drives the specified value onto the pin according to the current pin mode for the pin.
If the GPIO pin is configured as an input, the method updates the latched output value for the pin. The latched output value is driven onto the pin when the configuration for the pin changes to output.
Docs.summary: Drives the specified value onto the general purpose I/O (GPIO) pin according to the current pin mode for the pin if the pin is configured as an output, or updates the latched output value for the pin if the pin is configured as an input.
Docs.exception: This exception will be thrown on an attempt to write to a pin that hasn't been opened or is not configured as output.
